Ask HN: Interested in canaries build on top of AWS Lambda
text:
Hi HN,

I have hit this problem at a personal project where I would like to run Gatsby on AWS lambda, however Gatsby requires the last Nodejs runtime that AWS does not provide yet.

I am thinking to build my own set of canaries to test the very last version of common software building on top of AWS lambda.

Would people contribute to it? Would it solves someone else problem or just mine?

Ask HN: YC 2022 Cruderra
text:
Hi all) This is the 3rd time we are applying. We are building a backend design system tool.

https://cruderra.com/

We want to make a tool to create full cycle design documentation

We have a question: 1) When a new employee comes in, what API tool do you use? 2) How much time do you spend explaining documentation to developers? 3) How consistent is the development with the documentation? 4) When you do a technical audit, what are the requirements for documentation? 5) Would you like to have automatic construction of sequence diagrams? 6) Do you need employee collaboration in api tools? 7) What if I told you that I could make it so that an architect could create documentation in one day and distribute the task to every developer. Where you can discuss the development process at any stage. You would have a roadmap. And during the investment solicitation phase, would you have all the documentation to go through the technical audit?

Ask HN: Annoying middle-click paste in Chrome
text:
Let me start by apologising for asking this here. I suspect it isn't entirely in the spirit of typical HN discussion. It's just that I cannot find the solution elsewhere online despite my best efforts. Perhaps I'm growing incompetent in my old age.

On Ubuntu (20.04), you can use gnome-tweaks to disable the middle-click-to-paste feature. Once disabled here, it is applied to all gnome apps and assorted programs (for example the text editor, terminal, etc.).

However for some reason the middle-click-paste persists inside of Chrome. This is extremely frustrating because I am one of those users that likes to hold down middle-click to scroll (which is particularly ergonomic on my ThinkPad - fellow ThinkPad users will understand).

What's happening now however is that whenever I scroll in Chrome whilst typing an email or filling in forms it just randomly pastes whatever is in my clipboard. Aside from being annoying, I've on occasion also accidentally submitted / sent erroneously pasted text.

How on earth can I disable middle-click-paste in Chrome without disabling middle-click altogether?

Is there some kind of Chrome setting or flag or extension?

Help me HNers; you're my only hope.
